description: College-level microeconomics course exploring economic decision-making, markets, firms, competition, government intervention, and efficiency. Designed to prepare students for the AP Microeconomics exam and deeper economic study.

topics.name: Unit 1: The Fundamentals of Economics
topics.description: Opportunity cost, scarcity, production possibilities, marginal analysis, and basic economic models.

topics.name: Unit 2: Supply, Demand, and Market Equilibrium
topics.description: Supply and demand models, determinants, equilibrium price/quantity, and market adjustments.

topics.name: Unit 3: Elasticity and Consumer Choice
topics.description: Elasticity of demand and supply, total revenue effects, utility maximization, and indifference principles.

topics.name: Unit 4: Firm Production and Costs
topics.description: Short-run and long-run production, marginal product, cost curves, and economies of scale.

topics.name: Unit 5: Perfect Competition
topics.description: Price-taking behavior, profit maximization, shutdown rule, and long-run equilibrium.

topics.name: Unit 6: Monopoly
topics.description: Single-firm markets, price-setting, deadweight loss, natural monopoly, and price discrimination.

topics.name: Unit 7: Imperfect Competition
topics.description: Monopolistic competition, oligopoly, game theory basics, and market power.

topics.name: Unit 8: Factor Markets
topics.description: Labor supply and demand, marginal revenue product, wage determination, and capital markets.

topics.name: Unit 9: Market Efficiency & Government
topics.description: Consumer and producer surplus, taxes, subsidies, price controls, and welfare effects.

topics.name: Unit 10: Market Failures & Public Goods
topics.description: Externalities, public goods, common resources, Coase theorem, and government solutions.

topics.name: Unit 11: International Microeconomics
topics.description: Comparative advantage, trade barriers, tariffs, quotas, and micro-level trade impacts.

topics.name: Unit 12: Comprehensive Review & AP Exam Prep
topics.description: Full-scope review with mixed conceptual and graphical questions to prepare for the AP exam.
